abstract: Patrons of fabled Russian and Turkish Baths, 124-year-old East Village bath and steam house, have seen dramatic change in operations and clientele after owners Boris Tuberman and David Shapiro split operation down the middle, each running it on alternate weeks; move created distinct groups of customers, confusing some long-term customers who say facility often feels far more like gentrified spa than steamy men's denizen they have been accustomed to.

headline.print_headline: Shvitz or Spa? Depends on the Week
headline.main: After 124 Years, the Russian and Turkish Baths Are Still a Hot Spot

snippet: A longstanding bathhouse in the East Village has found ways to attract a new generation of customers — though they tend to come only every other week.
lead_paragraph: A longstanding bathhouse in the East Village has found ways to attract a new generation of customers — though they tend to come only every other week.
